caption:
This photograph captures a wild, pale-colored wolf standing alone in a rugged, natural landscape. The wolf is centered in the image, looking directly towards the camera with a cautious, focused gaze. Its light fur contrasts with the surrounding environment.

The terrain is a blend of various shrubs and small plants, showcasing a beautiful array of colors, including deep greens, muted yellows, and splashes of red and burgundy, suggesting it might be taken during autumn. The ground appears rocky and uneven, indicative of a mountainous or forested wilderness area.

The overall feel of the image is wild and untouched, with the lone wolf adding a sense of solitude and resilience. The natural lighting and dense plant life suggest this location is remote, possibly protected wilderness or a national park. The photograph offers a close look at wildlife in its natural habitat, emphasizing the beauty and the harsh reality of nature.
title: White female wolf in the Atigun Valley. This wolf dens in the riverbank of the Atigun inside the main valley about five miles south of Galbraith Camp. She roams at least 20 miles a day in search of food from the main valley den into the gorge and then back to the valley proper.
